title: Blockchain Technology
introduction: Blockchain is a distributed ledger technology that maintains a secure and decentralized record of transactions across multiple computers.

sections.title: How It Works
sections.content: Blockchain consists of blocks of data linked together in a chain. Each block contains a cryptographic hash of the previous block, a timestamp, and transaction data.

sections.title: Key Features
sections.content: Decentralization, transparency, immutability, and security are the main features of blockchain technology. Once data is recorded, it becomes very difficult to change.

sections.title: Use Cases
sections.content: Beyond cryptocurrencies, blockchain is used in supply chain management, voting systems, digital identity verification, smart contracts, and healthcare records.

sections.title: Challenges
sections.content: Scalability issues, high energy consumption, regulatory uncertainty, and integration with existing systems are some of the main challenges facing blockchain adoption.
